h1: Industrial Hygiene Software for Exposure Data & Compliance Management
heroCopy: AbateIQ provides a unified platform for managing exposure data across projects, sites, and personnel.
painPoints: Exposure data fragmentation across spreadsheets and disconnected systems.
Difficulty maintaining complete historical exposure records.
Slow audit preparation due to inconsistent documentation standards.
Loss of exposure history over time makes trend analysis and defensible decision-making harder.
workflow: Centralize field capture, monitoring, and reporting data.
Track exposure history across sites, projects, and personnel.
Deliver compliance dashboards and audit-ready outputs.
Maintain exposure histories across projects, sites, and roles so decisions are based on complete records.
Organize sampling by Similar Exposure Group (SEG) to support repeatable monitoring strategies.
Surface trends and exceedances with dashboards that are easy to explain to clients and regulators.
regulatoryReferences: OSHA recordkeeping practices for industrial hygiene programs.
EPA reporting patterns relevant to environmental operations.
NESHAP-linked documentation support where asbestos workflows apply.
featureBreakdown: Long-term exposure trend analysis and retention
Defensible exposure record continuity across sites

faqs.question: What does IH data centralization improve?
faqs.answer: It improves reporting speed, consistency, and defensibility while reducing audit preparation delays.

faqs.question: Can AbateIQ support multi-site IH operations?
faqs.answer: Yes. Exposure records and compliance workflows can be managed across multiple sites in one platform.

faqs.question: Why does exposure history matter?
faqs.answer: Complete exposure histories support trend detection, control verification, and defensible long-term worker health decisions.

faqs.question: Does AbateIQ support SEGs?
faqs.answer: Yes. AbateIQ can organize sampling and reporting around Similar Exposure Groups to improve consistency and monitoring strategy.
